documentation.description: Entries listed here will be removed from the project's composer.json file.
documentation.requirement: Only works on Webtourismus dev server. Only works with webtourismus/drupal-starterkit projects.
documentation.usage: Add thing to remove to 'remove' section in this file. Then run 'robo update' inside the target project directory.
documentation.limitation: Currently only repos, required packages and patches are supported. Might be extented in the future (e.g. scripts or other extra sections).

repositories.example_repo: When running 'robo update', the repo with the key 'example_repo' will be removed from the composer.json repositories section.

require.example_vendor/example_package: When running 'robo update', the package with name 'example_vendor/example_package' will be removed from the composer.json required section.
require.drupal_modules/warning: Mind that this is the last step of a multi-step process! Modules must be deactivated first - on all environments - before physically deleting them with composer.

example_vendor/example_package.example_key: When running 'robo update', the patch with the key 'example_key' will be removed from the composer.json patches section of example_vendor/example_package.
